prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: - Euler Angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system with a single face (face_1). Face_1 consists of the following loop (loop_1) and lines: - line_1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) - line_2: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.4167) - line_3: (0.75, 0.4167) to (0.0, 0.4167) - line_4: (0.0, 0.4167) to (0.0, 0.0) Loop_1 is a closed loop with 4 lines. Set the scaling parameter of the sketch to 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.5 and an opposite normal depth of 0.0, resulting in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions of this part are: - Length: 0.5 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.75 **Part 2: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Cutout** Create a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following properties: - Euler Angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.5, 0.25, 0.0) Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system with a single face (face_1). Face_1 consists of the following loop (loop_1) and lines: - line_1: (0.0, 0.4167) to (0.1667, 0.0) - line_2: (0.1667, 0.0) to (0.5, 0.0) - line_3: (0.5, 0.0) to (0.3333, 0.4167) - line_4: (0.3333, 0.4167) to (0.0, 0.4167) Loop_1 is a closed loop with 4 lines. Set the scaling parameter of the sketch to 0.5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch along the negative normal direction (cut feature) with an extrusion depth of 0.0 and an opposite normal depth of 0.1667, creating a cutout in the previously created part. The dimensions of this part are: - Length: 0.1667 - Width: 0.5 - Height: 0.5</description>
